lines.text:
[after they're fired out by a villain in their speeding car]
It's the first time I ever heard a bullet.
The one you don't hear is the bad one.
[Reassuringly]
It's all right. You can slow down to 60 0r 70 now.
Now I know you're The Saint.
I was almost a saint two minutes ago.
Tell me, what part of the states are you from? Sing Sing?
Nah, San Quentin.

[asking Simon Templar about his valet]
Can he cook, too?
Look, flatfoot, I cooked for twelve-hundred men three times a day for five years.
Oh, that must have been Sing Sing.
San Quentin, and there were no complaints.

[leaving a few minutes later]
Have you heard of a prison called Dartmoor?
So what?
They need a cook.

[Referring to the situation of the unconscious man on the road]
What do you think of it, Wilkins?
What you said... just a fight... probably nothing to it.
There's always something to it when Templar has his finger in the pie!

[Driving into London in their car]
You know, this is the first time I've ever seen dawn without a hangover.
I can't help wishing that man I knocked out had one.

[Driving away as Penny looks back at the man she's knocked unconscious]
Is he still out?
Cold.
How are you?

[as they are in a convertible at night]
Cold!

[Smiling]
Well, move over.
[She snuggles against him as they speed away]

[Sarcastically as he frisks Simon]
He ain't got a halo.
You know, Templar, if a man lives long enough, he's sure to run up against someone smarter than himself. In some professions he doesn't live much longer than that.
Your modesty overwhelms me, Mr. Lang.
But I haven't got a gun with me.

[Tossing her a gun]
Here.
Is it loaded?
Yeah, and it ain't no water pistol, so watch out where you squirt that lead.

[to Penny after she's been rescued]
We're glad to have you back, aren't we, Dugan?
Anything to break the monopoly. That's what I say.
